questionnaire_description: Taking into account the description and aim of the exercise and observing the repetition, answer the questions by assigning the number associated with the answer
exercise_name: Pelvis rotations on the transverse plane

exercise_stages.stage_1: The subject has to stand still with feet slightly apart.
exercise_stages.stage_2: Without moving the feet, the subject makes a circular rotation with the pelvis in clockwise direction.
exercise_stages.stage_3: Without moving the feet, the subject makes a circular rotation with the pelvis in counter clockwise direction.

body segment terminology.elbow extension angle: angle between the upper arm and forearm for each arm
body segment terminology.transverse spine base shift: The translation of the spine base in the transverse plane (front, back, left, right)
body segment terminology.knee extension angle: angle between the thigh and the calf for each leg
body segment terminology.vertical shoulder shift: The vertical translation of the shoulder (up, down)

PO_questions.x: Is the transverse spine base shift maximized during the clockwise rotation?
PO_questions.y: Is the transverse spine base shift maximized during the counterclockwise rotation?
PO_questions.1: Are the metrics in the above 2 questions achieved in the exercise?
PO_questions.2: Is the exercise carried out in a constant manner throughout? Is rise time equal to fall time?
PO_questions.3: Is the amplitude of the movement complete in the exercise? Is the amplitude maximized at the middle frame?

CF_questions._comment: # Default answer for questions a to h should be 3. DO NOT include this field in the result.
CF_questions.a: Is the shoulder distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.b: Is the subjest free of ANY vertical shoulder shift in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.c: Are the elbow extension angles symmetrical and constant across both arms in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.d: Are the knee extension angles symmetrical and constant across both legs in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.e: Are the hip distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.4: Based on your answer for a and b, is the posture of the head correct?
CF_questions.5: Based on your answer for a, and c, is the posture of the right arm correct?
CF_questions.6: Based on your answer for a, and c, is the posture of the left arm correct?
CF_questions.7: Based on your answer for e, is the posture of the trunk correct?
CF_questions.8: Based on your answer for e, is the posture of the pelvis correct?
CF_questions.9: Based on your answer for d and the evaluation sequence, is the posture of the right leg correct?
CF_questions.10: Based on your answer for d and the evaluation sequence, is the posture of the left leg correct?
